top.description: The $top system query option allows clients a required number of resources. Usually used in conjunction with the $skip query options

skip.description: The $skip system query option allows clients to skip a given number of resources. Usually used in conjunction with the $top query options

search.description: The $search system query option allows clients to request items within a collection matching a free-text search expression

compute.description: The $compute system query option allows clients to define computed properties that can be used in a $select or within a $filter or $orderby expression.

index.description: The $index system query option allows clients to do a positional insert into a collection annotated with using the Core.PositionalInsert term (see http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part2-url-conventions.html#VocCore)

schemaVersion.description: The $schemaversion system query option allows clients to specify the version of the schema against which the request is made. iterationParam.description: Name of the iteration parameter that can be referenced in actions/workflow. For each parallel iteration, this param should contain an unique element of the inputCollection array

batchSize.description: Specifies how many iterations may run in parallel at the same time. Used if 'mode' property is set to 'parallel' (default)

actions.description: Actions to be executed for each of the elements of inputCollection

oneOf.description: Total state execution timeout (including retries) (ISO 8601 duration format)
Workflow default timeouts

single.description: Single state execution timeout, not including retries (ISO 8601 duration format)

total.description: Total state execution timeout, including retries (ISO 8601 duration format)

actionExecTimeout.description: Single actions definition execution timeout duration (ISO 8601 duration format)

transition.description: Next transition of the workflow after state has completed

compensatedBy.description: Unique Name of a workflow state which is responsible for compensation of this state

usedForCompensation.description: If true, this state is used to compensate another state. Default is false

mode.description: Specifies how iterations are to be performed (sequentially or in parallel)

workflow_callbackstate.description: This state performs an action, then waits for the callback event that denotes completion of the action

action.description: Defines the action to be executed

eventRef.description: References an unique callback event name in the defined workflow events

oneOf.description: Total state execution timeout (including retries) (ISO 8601 duration format)
Workflow default timeouts

single.description: Single state execution timeout, not including retries (ISO 8601 duration format)

total.description: Total state execution timeout, including retries (ISO 8601 duration format)

actionExecTimeout.description: Single actions definition execution timeout duration (ISO 8601 duration format)

eventTimeout.description: Timeout duration to wait for consuming defined events (ISO 8601 duration format)

transition.description: Next transition of the workflow after all the actions have been performed

compensatedBy.description: Unique Name of a workflow state which is responsible for compensation of this state

usedForCompensation.description: If true, this state is used to compensate another state. Default is false

oneOf.description: Name of the starting workflow state
Workflow start definition

stateName.description: Name of the starting workflow state

schedule.description: Define the time/repeating intervals or cron at which workflow instances should be automatically started.

oneOf.description: Time interval (must be repeating interval) described with ISO 8601 format. Declares when workflow instances will be automatically created.  (UTC timezone is assumed)
Start state schedule definition

interval.description: Time interval (must be repeating interval) described with ISO 8601 format. Declares when workflow instances will be automatically created.

timezone.description: Timezone name used to evaluate the interval & cron-expression. (default: UTC)

oneOf.description: State end definition
State end definition

terminate.description: If true, completes all execution flows in the given workflow instance

produceEvents.description: Defines events that should be produced

compensate.description: If set to true, triggers workflow compensation. Default is false

workflow_produceeventdef.description: Produce an event and set its data

eventRef.description: References a name of a defined event

data.description: If String, expression which selects parts of the states data output to become the data of the produced event. If object a custom object to become the data of produced event.

contextAttributes.description: Add additional event extension context attributes

input.description: Workflow expression to filter the state data input

output.description: Workflow expression that filters the state data output

useData.description: If set to false, event payload is not added/merged to state data. In this case 'data' and 'toStateData' should be ignored. Default is true.

data.description: Workflow expression that filters the received event payload (default: '${ . }')

toStateData.description: Workflow expression that selects a state data element to which the filtered event should be added/merged into. If not specified, denotes, the top-level state data element.

fromStateData.description: Workflow expression that selects state data that the state action can use

useResults.description: If set to false, action data results are not added/merged to state data. In this case 'results' and 'toStateData' should be ignored. Default is true.

results.description: Workflow expression that filters the actions data results

toStateData.description: Workflow expression that selects a state data element to which the action results should be added/merged into. If not specified, denote, the top-level state data element
